MSceneDetailViewModel.Phrase: It's been a while since I've had a day off, so I decide to take Verona out on the town. Under the clear blue sky, the stalls are all crowded.

MSceneDetailViewModel.Name: Verona
MSceneDetailViewModel.Phrase: La la la~♪ Anywhere outside can be the outdoors~♪
Verona's tension is at an all-time high as she walks in front of me, scurrying around. It's her first-time shopping in this town, she says.

It will be a good opportunity for her to learn the right way to shop.
I hope they realize how much fun it is not to shop by catalog.

MSceneDetailViewModel.Name: Verona
MSceneDetailViewModel.Phrase: Oh, look, Conductor! They're selling chicks over there! As expected of a city, it's different. We don't have such colorful chicks in my hometown.
...She's about to get caught up in a scam right away.

MSceneDetailViewModel.Name: Verona
MSceneDetailViewModel.Phrase:
Pink, blue, green...Look, look!
Her body is the same purple as my eyes. Ohh~, cute.

MSceneDetailViewModel.Name: Verona
MSceneDetailViewModel.Phrase: Hey, Conductor. What color do you think their mother hen is?

MSceneDetailViewModel.Name: Verona
MSceneDetailViewModel.Phrase: I think it's a rainbow. After the rain, when the sun shines, the feathers shine in seven colors. Don't you think? Don't you think it's beautiful?

If she's so innocently pleased,
I can't say that they're just ordinary-colored chicks.
I think I have a long way to go in her social studies. I can see her being duped by a phony merchant in my mind's eye. I think it's best not to let her go shopping alone for the time being.
Eh, she's gone! I told her so many times not to wander around alone because it's dangerous...!

As I hurriedly search around, I spot Verona over the waves of people.
She is bouncing and waving at us in front of a stall.

MSceneDetailViewModel.Name: Verona
MSceneDetailViewModel.Phrase: Conductor, come on! Hurry up♪

MSceneDetailViewModel.Name: Verona
MSceneDetailViewModel.Phrase:
Gosh, where have you been?
You can't zone out. Don't get lost again, Conductor.

That's weird.
I don't know why I'm supposed to be the lost one.

MSceneDetailViewModel.Name: Verona
MSceneDetailViewModel.Phrase: But look! Don't these pumps look amazing?
Verona is wearing a pair of glass pumps. They seem to be for sale at an antique shop that has a stall on the side of the road.
The heels are quite high, but Verona does a dexterous twirl and turns in the pumps and strikes a snappy pose with her hands on her hips.

MSceneDetailViewModel.Name: Verona
MSceneDetailViewModel.Phrase: The moment I saw these pumps, I knew it was destiny. I knew it was inevitable. I'm sure they feel the same way. They fit my feet like they were made for me.

MSceneDetailViewModel.Name: Verona
MSceneDetailViewModel.Phrase:
They've had a number of customers try them on
and not one of them fit. Isn't that right, Mister?
The street vendor nods his head in agreement with Verona's words.
Hundreds of women have tried, but the young lady is the first to get her feet in. The street vendor speaks with admiration. "She is truly a chosen one..."

MSceneDetailViewModel.Name: Verona
MSceneDetailViewModel.Phrase:
Oh! The Chosen One! I'll have to buy it.
Don't you think so, Conductor?
Umm, yeah. Well...I guess.

I nod vaguely, but I have a bad feeling about it somehow. More than anything, I'm concerned about the weird vibe of this street vendor...especially his beard, which looks like it's pasted under his nose.

MSceneDetailViewModel.Name: Verona
MSceneDetailViewModel.Phrase: They're a little pricey, but they're worth it if you believe in fate. I'll take these pumps. Will you wrap them up for me? Wait a minute. I'll take them off now.

MSceneDetailViewModel.Name: Verona
MSceneDetailViewModel.Phrase: ...Huh?

MSceneDetailViewModel.Name: Verona
MSceneDetailViewModel.Phrase:
Oh, that's funny. What happened?
My pumps are stuck to my feet.

MSceneDetailViewModel.Name: Verona
MSceneDetailViewModel.Phrase: One, two...three!

MSceneDetailViewModel.Name: Verona
MSceneDetailViewModel.Phrase:
I can't. I can't take them off at all.
Conductor, can you help me?
I'm puzzled as to why it takes two people to take off the pumps. But...I'm not really surprised. We struggle for a while, drenched in sweat, but no matter how hard we try, we can't get them off.

MSceneDetailViewModel.Name: Verona
MSceneDetailViewModel.Phrase: Oh, no. It's like they're stuck to my feet. It's an honor to be the Chosen One, but what am I supposed to do in the shower? Hey, Mister?

MSceneDetailViewModel.Name: Verona
MSceneDetailViewModel.Phrase:
Hey, Mister Street Vendor!
Where do you think you're going? Wait!
When I look, I see a street vendor carrying a large wrapping cloth, trying to escape by tiptoeing. Verona catches up with him in the blink of an eye and grabs his arm.

G-give me a break! I'm sorry!
Just, just spare my life!

MSceneDetailViewModel.Name: Verona
MSceneDetailViewModel.Phrase: Oh no, I'm not going to kill you. I'm just holding you back.

MSceneDetailViewModel.Name: Verona
MSceneDetailViewModel.Phrase:
I haven't paid my bill yet, have I? No, don't forget to get your money.
You're a bit rash for a businessman, aren't you?
Is that what she's worried about!?
Wait. It's not just about the bill. I think you should ask this street vendor why he was trying to sell you those strange pumps.

MSceneDetailViewModel.Name: Verona
MSceneDetailViewModel.Phrase: Yeah, you're right.

MSceneDetailViewModel.Name: Verona
MSceneDetailViewModel.Phrase: So, tell me what these pumps are? Don't worry. I don't care if they have a history, I'll wear them if they're well designed.

―I'm sorry. I didn't mean to put you in harm's way.
I never imagined that these Cinderella pumps would be so powerful...

MSceneDetailViewModel.Name: Verona
MSceneDetailViewModel.Phrase: Cinderella?

MSceneDetailViewModel.Name: Verona
MSceneDetailViewModel.Phrase:
Did you just say Cinderella?
The phantom stage production of Cinderella, right?

MSceneDetailViewModel.Name: Verona
MSceneDetailViewModel.Phrase:
Wait. That means...
Could it be that these pumps are the "lost glass slippers"...?
The street vendor nod and says it's definitely authentic. Those glass shoes choose their owners. Even if they're the right size, they will not be able to be taken off unless you are the chosen one...
Hundreds of women have worn those shoes in the past. But I've never heard of anyone not being able to take them off. There's a reason why you were chosen.
Once you figure out why, the shoes will come off naturally, right?

After saying that, the street vendor puts the large wrapping cloth
back on his back and disappears into the hustle and bustle of the town.

MSceneDetailViewModel.Name: Verona
MSceneDetailViewModel.Phrase: Why did they choose me...?
Verona looks down at her feet and mutters to herself. The glass slippers don't answer her question, they just glow quietly, coolly, and clearly.
